Seisin.definition: the possession of land or chattels

orsei·zin[sēz-n].definition: [Anglo-French, from Old Frenchact of taking possession, fromto seize, of Germanic origin]

1.definition: the possession of land or chattels

sub_terms.a: the possession of land arising from livery of seisin see also
sub_terms.b: the possession of a freehold estate in land by one having title thereto

2.definition: the right to immediate possession of an estate or to immediate succession [ of an heir upon death of the testator]
